Administration.text:
Type:
Cycloplegic
, topical
anticholinergics
Dosage Forms:
Routes of Administration: Ophthalmic
Common Trade Names: Cyclogyl, Cylate, Pentolair

Adult_Dosing.text: 1-2 drops of 0.5%-2% solution, may repeat in 5-10min if needed

Pediatric_Dosing.text:
Small infants: 1 drop of 0.5%-2% solution
Children: 1-2 drops of 0.5%-2% solution, may repeat with 0.5%-1% solution in 5-10min if needed

Special_Populations.text:
Pregnancy Rating
: C
Lactation risk: infant risk cannot be ruled out
Renal dosing
Hepatic dosing

Contraindications.text:
Allergy to class/drug
Narrow-angle glaucoma or anatomically narrow angles

Serious.text:
Tachyarrythmia, vasodilation
Seizure
Ataxia, confusion, psychosis
Conjunctivitis
Raised intraocular pressure

Common.text:
Blurred vision
Burning sensation in eye
Photophobia

Serious.text:
Tachyarrythmia, vasodilation
Seizure
Ataxia, confusion, psychosis
Conjunctivitis
Raised intraocular pressure

Common.text:
Blurred vision
Burning sensation in eye
Photophobia

Blurred vision
Burning sensation in eye
Photophobia

Mechanism_of_Action.text: Anticholinergic, blocks the responses of the sphincter muscle of the iris and stimulation of ciliary body muscle, leading to cycloplegia and mydriasis.
